creator: aka@myself.com
text:
I suggest that targets can have access rights.
like

Access="public" -- (default) meaning that all can access the target.
Access="private" -- meaning that target can only be accessed from within the 
project.

Reasoning for suggestion:
By this it is possible to differentiate between internally tasks and externally 
tasks. It would become easier to make listings of commands from the commandline.

Best regards
Anders Kr. Andersen

creator: steve_l@iseran.com
text:
Anders,

You know that if you give a target a description tag it gets listed as 
a 'main' task other than a subproject. So for listing purposes, the solution 
is already pretty much implemented. 

Are there other needs of yours, such as the need to hide targets from external 
invocation?
